titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the In the Life records LSC.2178

p.date: Online finding aid last updated 23 August 2017.

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2025-04-02 15:04:46 -0700.

did.abstract: In the Life Media was founded in 1992 with a mission of bringing real LGBT stories into the media. The collection consists of records related to the production company In the Life and the production of its flagship television program In the Life.
did.physloc: Stored off-site. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use and Reproduction
userestrict.p: Property rights to the objects belong to UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

acqinfo.head: Provenance/Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of In the Life Media, 2013.

odd.head: UCLA Catalog Record ID
odd.p: UCLA Catalog Record ID: 9974250343606533

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], In the Life Records (Collection 2178). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.

We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Problematic Content and Description in UCLA's library collections and archives.

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: In the Life (also known as In the Life Media) was a production company founded in 1992 with the mission of broadcasting LGBT stories in an effort to challenge homophobia and negative perceptions. Airing in 1992 on six Public Broadcasting Stations, the television series In the Life (ITL) was the first nationally broadcast public television series dedicated to advocating visibility and equality for the LGBT community. During its series run from 1992-2012, ITL grew to reach over one hundred stations across the United States, as well as Canada. The television series gained critical acclaim, earning Emmy Award nominations, a Lambda Legal Liberty Award, the NLGJA Seigenthaler Award for excellence in network television, and a GLAAD Media Award for Outstanding TV Journalism-Newsmagazine.

ITL began as an entertainment-based, variety show, but after its first season it evolved into an in-the-field public affairs newsmagazine program, covering a wide range of topics pertaining to LGBT issues including religious, political, and family issues, gay rights, matters specific to LGBT youths, and HIV/AIDS. Episode highlights include coverage of the 1993 March on Washington, the 1994 Gay Games, and the Stonewall 25th anniversary in New York. The series was also known for its coverage of various art and cultural events, highlighting important contributions from the LGBT community. The last episode of In the Life aired in December of 2012.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of records related to the production company In the Life and the production of its flagship television program In the Life. The bulk of the files document various aspects of production of In the Life episodes including episode run downs and transcripts, contracts, research, and publicity. Additionally there are files pertaining to marketing and development, publicity and press, the office of the Executive Director, the Board of Directors, and series producer, Jacqueline Gares.

arrangement.head: Organization and Arrangement
arrangement.p:
Arranged in the following series:
Production Records
Legal Records
Executive Director's Files
Board of Director's Files
Publicity and Press Materials
Development, Marketing, and Communications Files
Jacqueline Gares Files
Photographic Materials
Office Resources

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The series documents all aspects of production for In the Life episodes, and may include one or more of the following information: episode transcripts, a small number of releases and agreements, episode rundowns, memoranda, shot logs, music and footage cue sheets, and lower thirds lists. Additionally there may be episode descriptions, story pitches, press releases, publicity stills for specific episodes, episode guides, broadcast schedules, newsletters, and research material for episode or segment development in the form of clippings and/or ephemera. The series also contains production material and license agreements related to In the Life's Encore Editions. The series may contain duplicate articles, newsletters, and publicity stills found in Publicity and Press Materials series. The files in the series are arranged by episode number when known and/or alphabetically by folder titles. Legal Records series may contain additional documentation, releases, and agreements pertaining to specific episodes.

The series documents all aspects of production for In the Life episodes, and may include one or more of the following information: episode transcripts, a small number of releases and agreements, episode rundowns, memoranda, shot logs, music and footage cue sheets, and lower thirds lists. Additionally there may be episode descriptions, story pitches, press releases, publicity stills for specific episodes, episode guides, broadcast schedules, newsletters, and research material for episode or segment development in the form of clippings and/or ephemera. The series also contains production material and license agreements related to In the Life's Encore Editions. The series may contain duplicate articles, newsletters, and publicity stills found in Publicity and Press Materials series. The files in the series are arranged by episode number when known and/or alphabetically by folder titles. Note: see also the Legal Records series for additional documentation, releases, and agreements pertaining to specific episodes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The series consists of legal records related to specific episodes and include one of more of the following documents: appearance, material, and location releases, talent and work-for-hire agreements, and clip and music licensing agreements. Also included are a small amount of licensing agreements and contracts between In the Life and various television stations and/or broadcast companies. The files in the series are arranged loosely by episode number and/or alphabetically by folder titles. The Production Records series may contain additional documentation, releases, and agreements pertaining to specific episodes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Executive Director's Files include materials such as annual budgets, strategic plans, company history, staff and board meeting minutes, contracts, licensing agreements, copyright information, and reports from various internal departments and external consultants. There is no specific arrangement to the series.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Publicity and Press Materials consist of clippings, press kits, newsletters, publicity stills. The bulk of the clippings represent write-ups about ITL. Additionally there are a lesser amount of clippings documenting LGBT-related films, television programming, theatre productions, and exhibits, some of which may have been used as potential story ideas for ITL segments, such as Real to Reel and In the States. The series may contain duplicates of materials found in the Production Records series, such as episode guides and publicity stills. There is no specific arrangement to this series.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Development, Marketing, and Communications files consist of materials pertaining to branding, fundraising and development, and outreach. Includes documentation for In the Life benefits and special events as well as development and communications committees, strategic planning reports, and grant applications. There is no specific arrangement to this series.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The series includes photographs, slides, and a small amount of proof sheets and negatives. The materials represent In the Life events, including Season Premiere Galas, and individuals at the In the Life offices. Additionally, there are images of In the Life representatives advocating for the LGBT community at various events, such as the 1993 March on Washington, the 1996 Republican
